div.p: Wrote to Dear Abbie HossMrs. H. : -- "I never thought it likely that Oxford, GeorgiaOxford would get very cold. But I was mistaken. For the several days past, water freezes in my room most nights & sometimes in day time. Am enjoying cold weather, however.

"Nothing unusual to disturb the monotonymonotoy of the college routine. A South CarolinaS.C. boy, named Wilson, had to go home or rather had to be taken home on account of lunatic fits. This state of mind was brought on by excessive use of cigarettescigaretts. When he got into a fit -- & that he did many times an hour -- he poured out 'cusses' in an unbroken stream. One evening Warren CandlerDr. Candler called on him. Hearing the Warren CandlerDr. Wilson cried out "Oh! Look at that bob-tailed monkey! Take him out! Quick!" Then followed a long string of 'cusses' of the queerest & worst kinds.
Am waiting for an answer from Young John AllenDr. Allen in regard to my [?] movement. In case of his telling me come back to Shanghai -- which is most likely -- I shall have to go to Nashville, Tennessee"Nash. on my way to San Francisco, CaliforniaSan F'co,
